title: Labor Pains and Opportunities in Baseball
sub_head: A joint venture and the business promise of betting add up to a promising future.
body:
The current labor strife in Major League Baseball reflects the ebb and flow of some 50 years of struggle between the club owners and the players’ union.
The union was molded and led for some 20 years by Marvin Miller (1917-2012), whose tenure resulted in two notable achievements. First, he brought to the players via collective bargaining health and pension programs that are the richest permitted by federal law—the best benefits the league can agree to provide.
